Action processing order when working with an object
Opening a new object
When opening an object, the sequence of actions performed on the server and client sides of the application depends on whether an existing object is being opened, a copy is being created, or a new object is being created:
Event algorithms, expressions, and autonumbering may include settings that trigger actions on the interface, including overwriting previously set attribute values.
The calculation of
expressions
with active "Calculate when creating new objects" and "Set result in attribute" options is not performed for attributes with predefined
default values
, including those obtained through
autonumbering
.
Data recovery from cache occurs when the
"Save entered data when closing a new (unsaved) object" setting
is active.
If
autonumbering
is set with the calculation time for the
"Upon creation"
number, the sequence number will be assigned by the system each time a new object is created or an existing object is copied.
In the case of copying an object, the sequence number assigned in the copied object will be used. If absent, the number assigned by autonumbering will be used.

Changing object data
Actions performed on the server and client sides of the application as a result of attribute value changes:
Event algorithms, expressions, and autonumbering may include settings that trigger actions on the interface.
Find more about:
expressions/autocalculations
;
OnChanged event
.
Closing object
When closing an object, the following sequence of actions is performed:
Event algorithms may include settings that trigger actions on the interface.
Data is saved to the cache when the
"Save entered data when closing a new (unsaved) object" setting
is active.
Find more about:
screen form events
;
storing unsaved data
.
Deleting object
The sequence of actions when deleting an object can be represented in the following diagram:
An object is deleted only if the transaction completes successfully. If any error occurs at any stage, the transaction is aborted, and all changes are rolled back.
If the action for a dependent object is set to "Move to recycle bin" or "Delete permanently", object
validations
and
search for related objects
will also be performed for the dependent object within the current transaction.
Check algorithms and events may include settings that trigger actions on the interface.

Saving object
When saving an object that already exists in the system, the following sequence of actions is performed:
An object is saved to the database only if the transaction completes successfully. If any error occurs at any stage, the transaction is aborted, and all changes are rolled back.
When saving a new object, the sequence of actions can be represented in the following diagram:
